sources.eng_title: Jordi Fernández: The First Spanish Coach to Win in the NBA
sources.summary: Jordi Fernández, a Catalan coach, has become the first Spanish coach to win a game in the NBA as a head coach. He achieved this milestone with the Brooklyn Nets, who won their first game of the season against the Milwaukee Bucks 102-115. Fernández has a long history in the NBA, starting as a development coach in the Impact Basketball Academy in Las Vegas in 2006. He later worked as an assistant coach for the Cleveland Cavaliers, Denver Nuggets, and Sacramento Kings, where he helped develop young players and contributed to the team's success. His experience and reputation made him a strong candidate for the Brooklyn Nets' head coaching position, and he was officially appointed on April 22, 2024. The Nets have a young and talented roster, but they lack discipline and consistency. Fernández's defensive approach and ability to develop young players make him a good fit for the team. His first win is a significant achievement, and he is expected to continue improving the team's performance and developing young players like Nico Claxton and Cam Thomas.
sources.title: La primera de muchas, Jordi

sources.eng_title: NBA League Pass Watch Guide: Week 2
sources.summary: The second week of the 2024-25 NBA regular season features several marquee matchups, including LeBron James' return to Cleveland, a showdown between the Celtics and Bucks, and a rematch between the Lakers and Suns. The Celtics have made a record 68 3-pointers in their first three games, while the Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo and Damian Lillard are looking to improve their team's record. In another Eastern Conference clash, the Knicks will host the undefeated Cavs, led by Donovan Mitchell. The Nets' Cam Thomas, who is averaging 30.7 ppg, will face off against last year's Kia NBA MVP Nikola Jokić and the Nuggets. The Lakers will visit Cleveland, where LeBron James spent half of his record-tying 22 NBA seasons, and the Pelicans and Warriors will face off in a two-game back-to-back set in San Francisco. Steph Curry's status will be key to watch after he suffered an ankle sprain on Sunday.
sources.title: NBA League Pass Watch Guide: Week 2

sources.eng_title: Every NBA Team's Most Fun Player To Watch During This Season
sources.summary: The 2024-25 NBA season has tipped off with exciting performances from various players across the league. Trae Young of the Atlanta Hawks is known for his electric shooting range and fearless drives, making him a thrill to watch. Jayson Tatum of the Boston Celtics has shown versatility and scoring ability, leading the team to a strong start. Cam Thomas of the Brooklyn Nets has become the team's primary offensive weapon, scoring from all three levels and hitting tough shots. LaMelo Ball of the Charlotte Hornets has made waves with his flashy passes, deep threes, and high IQ on the court. Zach LaVine of the Chicago Bulls has opened the season in strong form, proving why he's the team's most electrifying player. Donovan Mitchell of the Cleveland Cavaliers has started the season on fire, reminding everyone why he's the team's main guy. Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks has delivered jaw-dropping performances, showcasing his relentless scoring ability. Nikola Jokic of the Denver Nuggets has been putting up big numbers, but the team's opening hasn't gone as planned. Cade Cunningham of the Detroit Pistons has started the season strong, showing why he's the team's cornerstone. Stephen Curry of the Golden State Warriors has hit the ground running, delivering stellar performances in the team's first two games. Jalen Green of the Houston Rockets has wasted no time bringing excitement to the team's season, showcasing his explosive drives and flashy footwork. Tyrese Haliburton of the Indiana Pacers has started the season with some impressive performances, setting the tone for the team. Kawhi Leonard of the Los Angeles Clippers is currently sidelined due to a knee injury, but his absence leaves a major gap in the team's lineup. LeBron James of the Los Angeles Lakers has dropped a jaw-dropping triple-double, showing his ability to take over late and push the team to a 3-0 start. Ja Morant of the Memphis Grizzlies has brought his signature energy and showmanship to the team, delivering standout performances. Jimmy Butler of the Miami Heat has come roaring back in the team's next game, dropping 26 points with 8 assists to lead the Heat past Charlotte. Giannis Antetokounmpo of the Milwaukee Bucks has opened the season with a bang, putting up classic 'Greek Freak' performances. Anthony Edwards of the Minnesota Timberwolves has kicked off the season in serious form, showing why he's the face of the franchise. Zion Williamson of the New Orleans Pelicans has had a strong start to the season, showcasing his versatility and impact on both ends of the floor. Jalen Brunson of the New York Knicks has started this season as the team's go-to offensive force, delivering efficient scoring right from the jump.
sources.title: Every NBA Team's Most Fun Player To Watch During This Season

sources.eng_title: Nathan MacKinnon returns MVP favor to Nikola Jokic
sources.summary: Nathan MacKinnon presented Nikola Jokic with the 2023-24 NBA MVP award, returning the favor after Jokic presented MacKinnon with the 2024 Hart Memorial Trophy. Jokic has won three of the last four NBA MVP awards and has also won the 2023 Finals MVP award. MacKinnon has won several awards, including the 2023-24 Ted Lindsay Award and the 2023-24 Hart Memorial Trophy. The Nuggets are facing heavy criticism after losing their first two games of the 2024-25 season, with some analysts, like Stephen A. Smith, questioning their roster and ability to compete with younger teams. Jokic acknowledged the team's struggles, saying 'We are not a good shooting team, I think. Except Mike [Porter Jr.] and then Jamal [Murray],' and expressed confidence in their ability to improve and find advantages on the floor. The Nuggets will play their next three games on the road against the Toronto Raptors, Brooklyn Nets, and Minnesota Timberwolves.
sources.title: Nathan MacKinnon returns MVP favor to Nikola Jokic

sources.summary: The NBA has released its schedules for this weekend, with several games taking place on Friday, October 25, Saturday, October 26, Sunday, October 27, Monday, October 28, and Tuesday, October 29. Some of the notable matchups include the Philadelphia 76ers at Toronto Raptors, Brooklyn Nets at Orlando Magic, and Los Angeles Lakers at Phoenix Suns. The full schedule is as follows: Friday, October 25: Philadelphia 76ers at Toronto Raptors (0000/2300), Brooklyn Nets at Orlando Magic (0000/2300), and 8 other games. Saturday, October 26: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets (2200/2100), Miami Heat at Charlotte Hornets (0000/2300), and 7 other games. Sunday, October 27: Philadelphia 76ers at Indiana Pacers (2030/1930), Milwaukee Bucks at Brooklyn Nets (2300/2200), and 4 other games. Monday, October 28: Indiana Pacers at Orlando Magic (0000/2300), Washington Wizards at Atlanta Hawks (0030/2330), and 7 other games. Tuesday, October 29: Denver Nuggets at Brooklyn Nets (0030/2330), Dallas Mavericks at Minnesota Timberwolves (0030/2330), and 4 other games. 'The NBA has released its schedules for this weekend,' said the Daily Mail Online. 'Fans can catch their favorite teams in action on Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday.'

sources.eng_title: Ranking the best and worse NBA Cup courts for 2024
sources.summary: The NBA has unveiled the court designs for the 2024 NBA Cup, giving teams more freedom to create unique and eye-catching designs. Here's a ranking of the top five and bottom five courts: The top five include the Portland Trail Blazers' subtle yet stunning 'City of Roses' design, the Charlotte Hornets' beehive-inspired court, the Brooklyn Nets' sleek gray design, the Los Angeles Lakers' skyline and palm tree design, and the Houston Rockets' HAL 9000-inspired court. The bottom five include the Detroit Pistons' 'fever dream' court, the Golden State Warriors' missed opportunity, the Toronto Raptors' barbed stripe design, the Denver Nuggets' 'Mile High City' design, and the Washington Wizards' confusing logo highlight. 'It's a new look for the in-season tournament, and teams have really run with it,' said an NBA spokesperson. 'We're excited to see how the courts will come to life during the games.'
sources.title: Ranking the best and worse NBA Cup courts for 2024

sources.eng_title: NBA Power Rankings: Celtics enter season ready to repeat
sources.summary: TheScore's NBA Power Rankings are out, and the Boston Celtics are ranked number one, followed closely by the Oklahoma City Thunder and the New York Knicks. The Celtics, led by Joe Mazzulla, are expected to dominate the East again, while the Thunder have made significant additions, including Alex Caruso and Isaiah Hartenstein. The Knicks, meanwhile, have acquired Mikal Bridges and Karl-Anthony Towns in an effort to capture their first title since 1973. The Denver Nuggets, Philadelphia 76ers, and Dallas Mavericks round out the top five. At the bottom of the list are the Washington Wizards, Brooklyn Nets, and Detroit Pistons, who are all expected to struggle this season.
sources.title: NBA Power Rankings: Celtics enter season ready to repeat

key_points: The Denver Nuggets are 19-10 this season and are favored by 4.5 points against the Brooklyn Nets, who are 13-14 and on a four-game losing streak.
The game is scheduled for December 22, 2023, at 7:30 p.m. ET, with an over/under set at 230 points.
The Nuggets' offense is led by two-time MVP Nikola Jokic, averaging 26.5 points, 12.4 rebounds, and 9.3 assists per game.
Denver ranks in the top 10 in defensive efficiency, allowing fewer than 1.13 points per possession, and is strong in second-chance points allowed.
The Nets perform better at home, with a +5.1 net rating at Barclays Center, and are among the top five in the NBA in 3-point shooting percentage (38.4%).
Brooklyn's defense is also notable, ranking in the top eight for field goal percentage allowed (45.7%) and contesting shots effectively.

Why the Nuggets can cover
-------------------------

Denver's offense keys its overall effectiveness, but its defense is stout this season. The Nuggets are in the top 10 in defensive efficiency, yielding fewer than 1.13 points per possession. Denver is also in the top 10 in second-chance points allowed, 2-point percentage allowed, 3-point percentage allowed, and assists allowed this season. Additionally, the Nuggets are facing a Nets team that struggles mightily in creating free throws, averaging fewer than 20 attempts per game.

On the offensive side, the Nuggets revolve around two-time NBA MVP , who is averaging 26.5 points, 12.4 rebounds, and 9.3 assists per game. Jokic is the centerpiece of an offense that is generating almost 1.18 points per possession, and Denver is in the top three in assists (29.6 per game), turnover avoidance (12.1 per game), and points in the paint (55.5 per game). No NBA team has a better assist-to-turnover ratio (2.44) than Denver, and Brooklyn is the league's worst team in turnover creation (11.7 per game) and steals (6.1 per game). .

Why the Nets can cover
----------------------

The Nets have been much better at home than on the road this season, including a stellar +5.1 net rating at Barclays Center. Brooklyn is in the top five of the NBA in 3-point percentage (38.4%) and 3-pointers per game (14.7), and the Nets also boost efficiency on the offensive glass. The Nets are grabbing almost 31% of missed shots this season, a top-10 figure in the NBA, and Brooklyn is above-average in assists (26.0 per game) and turnover avoidance (13.2 per game). Denver is in the bottom five of the league in turnover creation on defense, forcing only 12.4 giveaways per game.

On the other end, Brooklyn is able to contest shots in strong fashion. The Nets are in the top eight of the league in field goal percentage allowed (45.7%) and 2-point percentage allowed (51.8%). Brooklyn is also adept at preventing free throw attempts, yielding only 21.0 per game, and Denver struggles at the line. The Nuggets are in the bottom five of the league in free throw creation (20.3 attempts per game) and free throw accuracy (72.5%). .

Nuggets vs. Nets prediction, odds, pick, how to watch - 12/22/2023
==================================================================

Denver looks for three-straight wins as the Nets try to avoid another straight loss.

ByDec 22, 2023 at 10:52 AM ET

!ClutchPoints is not affiliated with, endorsed by, or in any way connected to any sportsbook. Gambling is not offered on this website in any form.

We’re set to bring you another betting prediction and pick for today’s action around the NBA as we turn our attention towards this next cross-conference matchup. The **Denver Nuggets (19-10)** will visit the **Brooklyn Nets (13-14)** as both teams are riding different types of momentum. Check out our NBA odds  for our Nuggets-Nets prediction and pick.

The Denver Nuggets are currently third in the Northwest Division and they’re playing hot right now winning five of their last six games. Particularly, they’re coming into this game riding back-to-back wins over the Dallas Mavericks and Toronto Raptors. They’ve got their swagger back with Murray fully inserted into the lineup and they’ll look for three in a row tonight.

The Brooklyn Nets are currently fourth in the Atlantic Division, but they’re doing a great job of keeping the gap small between them and the leading teams. However, they’ll clearly need to do more in terms of winning as they’ve lost their last four consecutive games. They’re hoping to break their streak and get back into the habit of winning games.

_**Here are the , courtesy of FanDuel.**_

**NBA Odds: Nuggets-Nets Odds**
-------------------------------

Denver Nuggets: -4.5 (-112)

Brooklyn Nets: +4.5 (-108)

Over: 231.5 (-110)

Under: 231.5 (-110)

**How to Watch Nuggets vs. Nets**
---------------------------------

Time: 7:30 p.m. ET/ 4:30 p.m PT

TV: NBA TV, Altitude Sports, YES Network

Stream: fuboTV ()

**Why The Nuggets Could Cover The Spread**
------------------------------------------

\`The Nuggets come into this game following a solid 113-104 win over the Toronto Raptors in which they controlled the pace of the game through all four quarters. Against good defensive teams, the Nuggets are able to adapt their game and slow the pace down to work their offensive sets. In low-scoring games, the Nuggets have enough strength on defense to come up with crucial stops and they have the offensive firepower to hit the final shot. Prior, they beat the Dallas Mavericks by a whopping 26 point and Jamal Murray has been leading the way since his return to the court.

The Nuggets see great success when all aspects of their game are meshing well. While they’re not the fastest scoring team or the most dominant on defense, they do all the little things right and winning games for them seems effortless when Jokic and Murray play to their capabilities. They’ll also have confidence knowing they already beat this Nets team by double-digits once before and they’re on a tough losing streak coming in – look for the Nuggets to fully take advantage as they’ll try to jump out to and early lead. Expect Jokic to facilitate for his teammates as Jamal Murray tries his hot hand in the scoring.

Related NewsArticle continues below

 Texans vs. Jets prediction, odds, pick for NFL Week 92h](https://clutchpoints.com/texans-vs-jets-prediction-odds-pick-for-nfl-week-9-2024) Tulane vs. Charlotte prediction, odds, pick for CFB Week 102h](https://clutchpoints.com/tulane-vs-charlotte-prediction-odds-pick-for-cfb-week-10-2024) Kennesaw State vs. Western Kentucky prediction, odds, pick for CFB Week 103h](https://clutchpoints.com/kennesaw-state-vs-western-kentucky-prediction-odds-pick-for-cfb-week-10) Jacksonville State vs. Liberty prediction, odds, pick for CFB Week 104h](https://clutchpoints.com/jacksonville-state-vs-liberty-prediction-odds-pick-for-cfb-week-10)

**Why The Nets Could Cover The Spread**
---------------------------------------

The Brooklyn Nets had a winning record prior to their last four consecutive losses and it’s clear that they’ll need to avoid losing streaks at all costs if they want to have any chance of competing in the East. It won’t be easy as Ben Simmons will have to wait another two weeks before returning and role players like Lonnie Walker and Dennis Smith Jr. remain on the injury report. Three of their last four losses have also come by double-digits, so they’re hard-pressed to find answers right now and get back on the winning track. Their last two losses marked poor shooting nights from the field, so they’re hoping for a better performance as short underdogs here.

The Brooklyn Nets are actually one of the best covering teams in the NBA, going 17-9-1 ATS overall and 10-3-1 ATS when playing at home. Clearly they’ve found comfort in playing at Barclay’s Center, but they may not be 100% healthy ahead of this one and they’ll need the fans to will them to a win. With how streaky their shooting has been, rebounding the ball will become a crucial focal point as we could see a high number of missed shots on both sides.

**Final Nuggets-Nets Prediction & Pick**
----------------------------------------

Both teams are feeling the meat of their schedule and both come into this game with lengthy injury reports. There’s nothing major ailing either one of their squads, but it’s clear that both teams are beginning to feel the weight of their schedules. In a game like this, we have to favor the defending champs and their ability to hang in the game with their defense. The Nets have struggled to find their shot recently and it’ll become much harder if the Nuggets put the clamps on them defensively. I expect Jokic to have double-digit assists and Jamal Murray to score 30+ as they grab this comfortable win.

**Final Nuggets-Nets Prediction & Pick: Denver Nuggets -4.5 (-112)**

web_search_results.title: Nuggets vs. Nets (Oct 29, 2024) Pregame - ESPN
key_points: The Denver Nuggets (0-2) will face the Brooklyn Nets (1-2) in a non-conference matchup on October 29, 2024, at 11:30 PM EDT.
Brooklyn finished the previous season with a record of 32-50, while Denver had a strong season with a 57-25 record.
The Nuggets averaged 114.9 points per game last season, allowing 109.6 points to opponents.
Injuries are a concern for both teams: the Nets have multiple players out due to foot and hamstring issues, while the Nuggets have a player out for the season with an Achilles injury.
The game will take place at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn, NY.

The Nuggets' current season statistics show an average of 95.5 points per game and 47.0 rebounds per game.
Christian Braun is noted as a key player with an average of 13.5 points per game.

web_search_results.title: Teams Advanced | Stats | NBA.com
key_points: The analysis includes performance metrics for the Denver Nuggets and Brooklyn Nets.
Key statistics such as Offensive Rating (OffRtg), Defensive Rating (DefRtg), and Net Rating (NetRtg) are provided for both teams.
The Nuggets have an OffRtg of 129.0 and a DefRtg of 113.1, indicating a strong offensive performance.
The Nets have an OffRtg of 125.5 and a DefRtg of 105.2, showcasing their competitive edge in offense and defense.
Both teams are ranked highly in various statistical categories, reflecting their overall performance in the current season.

web_search_results.title: Nuggets vs. Nets (Oct 29, 2024) Pregame - ESPN
key_points: The Denver Nuggets (0-2) face the Brooklyn Nets (1-2) in a non-conference matchup on October 29, 2024, at 11:30 PM EDT.
Brooklyn finished the previous season with a 32-50 record, averaging 6.8 steals, 5.2 blocks, and 12.3 turnovers per game.
Denver had a strong record of 57-25 last season, averaging 114.9 points per game while allowing 109.6 points.
Injuries reported for the Nets include players out due to foot and hamstring injuries, while the Nuggets have a player out for the season with an Achilles injury.
The game will take place at Barclays Center in Brooklyn, New York.

web_search_results.title: Analysis: Nuggets built a championship team the right way, and built it to last
key_points: The Denver Nuggets won the NBA Championship on June 12, 2023, defeating the Miami Heat in Game 5.
All five Nuggets starters are under 30 years old, indicating a strong foundation for future success.
Nuggets coach Michael Malone referenced Pat Riley's philosophy on evolving from a 'nobody' to a 'dynasty' after their championship win.
Nikola Jokic, the Finals MVP, is recognized as a unique talent, and his performance is expected to improve further.
Jamal Murray is likened to iconic second options in NBA history, emphasizing his selflessness and impact alongside Jokic.
The Nuggets achieved a dominant playoff run, going 16-4 and never trailing in any series.
Malone emphasized the importance of patience and belief in their strategy, suggesting the team is built for sustained success.

  ](https://apnews.com/author/tim-reynolds)

By  

Published \[hour\]:\[minute\] \[AMPM\] \[timezone\], \[monthFull\] \[day\], \[year\] Published 4:36 AM UTC, June 13, 2023

Share

Share

*   Copy
    
    Link copied
    
*

*   
*   
*   
*   
*   )

This may be just the start for the Denver Nuggets.

The newly crowned NBA champions — they got there Monday night,  to end the NBA Finals in five games – have five starters that are all 30 and under. They have a superstar leading the way, an elite second option, and a slew of really good players who could have bigger roles elsewhere yet chose to be part of something more meaningful.

All of that could have been said about the Golden State Warriors when they won their first of their four most recent titles in 2015.

Now, it’s the Nuggets who are following a similar — and proven — formula.

“You know, Pat Riley said something many years ago,” Nuggets coach Michael Malone said after it was all over. “I used to have it up on my board when I was a head coach in Sacramento, and it talked about the evolution in this game and how you go from a nobody to an upstart, and you go from an upstart to a winner and a winner to a contender and a contender to a champion, and the last step is after a champion is to be a dynasty.”

Even in a championship moment, Malone is already thinking about more. Riley, the Heat president and a nine-time champion as a coach, player and executive, is wired the same way.

RELATED COVERAGE

      ](https://apnews.com/article/paolo-banchero-orlando-d73147c19aa9ab9889d64a66472cadfb)



      ](https://apnews.com/article/dwyane-wade-statue-52c3a4b92fd18582b256852c60e5c7c6)



      ](https://apnews.com/article/curry-ankle-warriors-add31c5afc465fd043d22401a9e0464c)



It’s not crazy to think the Nuggets can do more. For starters, they have Nikola Jokic.

There are other stars who stand out in their own ways — Philadelphia’s Joel Embiid replaced Jokic as MVP this year, past MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo of Milwaukee may be the best two-way player in the league, Dallas’ Luka Doncic is surely going to be an MVP before long — but there’s no other Jokic, who has gone from second-round pick to triple-double machine.

It’s time to end all debate about Jokic. He’s slow, can’t jump and will never wow anyone with athleticism. And none of that matters. He’s smart, he’s selfless and he’s unstoppable. Period. End of story. The best player in the playoffs, the NBA Finals MVP, and now the big man from Sombor, Serbia is a champion. The days of any Jokic slander being allowed are officially over.

“I think there’s more to come, actually, from Jok,” Nuggets guard Jamal Murray said. “I think we haven’t seen a side of Jok that we are going to see where he can be just pure dominance all the way, the whole game, even more than he has been.”

Here’s what the other 29 teams should say when they hear that: “Yikes.”

Murray is to Jokic what Dwyane Wade was to LeBron James, what Kobe Bryant was to Shaquille O’Neal (before it became the other way around), what Scottie Pippen was to Michael Jordan. He is Robin next to Batman, a guy who would be a No. 1 option on many other teams yet checked his ego at the door and made it work in Denver.

Murray has sacrificed some stats. Some spotlight, too. The championship ring that he’ll be getting this fall, however, will have exactly the same amount of diamonds as the one Jokic will get. It all evens out.

“To be here just kind of rounds it out and shows that when we are given the right circumstances and everybody healthy, God willing, we can do it,” Murray said. “I think when we’re playing our best basketball, we are a very hard team to stop.”

It’s difficult to argue that point.

To be fair, this wasn’t the toughest path a team ever took to a title. Denver beat two No. 8 seeds — Minnesota and Miami — along with a No. 7 seed in the Los Angeles Lakers and a No. 4 seed in Phoenix to win this championship. But it was dominant. The Nuggets never trailed in a series. They went 16-4 in the postseason. They won 10 of their final 11 games. They left no doubt.

Malone was an assistant coach in Golden State just as the Warriors were starting down the path of becoming the NBA’s immovable object. He left two years before Stephen Curry’s first title to take over in Sacramento, getting fired early into Year 2 there. Then Denver hired him, and his first three seasons there resulted in zero playoff appearances. Usually, that gets a guy fired.

The Nuggets kept him. The debt was repaid in full on Monday night. Patience paid off, and so did institutional belief that Malone was the right guy, that Jokic — the greatest No. 41 pick in NBA draft history — would become a great, that Denver was building something the right way.

“You know, it’s not for everybody,” Malone said. “This was the best course for us, and it’s allowed us to get here.”

It very well may allow them to stay there.

Winning isn’t easy and winning a championship is darn near impossible. There have been five different champions in the last five years now. Three of those titlists — Toronto (2019), the Lakers (2020) and Milwaukee (2021) — have since fired the coaches who won those championships. Getting to the top is hard. Staying on top is tougher. Malone knows this, and starting this fall, the Nuggets are going to learn it.

But he thinks they’re also built for whatever comes next.

“We’re not satisfied,” Malone said. “We accomplished something this franchise has never done before, but we have a lot of young talented players in that locker room, and I think we just showed through 16 playoff wins what we’re capable of on the biggest stage in the world.”

Seven Nuggets players are on the injury report: Kentavious Caldwell-Pope (out, concussion protocol), Vlatko Cancar (out, left knee surgery), Collin Gillespie (out, G League two-way), Aaron Gordon (probable, right heel strain), Jay Huff (out, G League two-way), Braxton Key (out, G League two-way), and Jamal Murray (probable, bilateral ankle sprains).

The Brooklyn Nets also have seven players listed: Noah Clowney (out, G League assignment), Dorian Finney-Smith (questionable, left knee soreness), Keon Johnson (out, G League two-way), Ben Simmons (out, left lower back nerve impingement), Dennis Smith Jr. (out, upper back sprain), Lonnie Walker IV (out, left hamstring strain), and Dariq Whitehead (out, G League assignment).
The game is expected to give the Nuggets a significant advantage due to the number of players out for the Nets.
The matchup is scheduled for 9:00 p.m. EST on December 14, 2023.

Injury Report: Denver Nuggets vs Brooklyn Nets
==============================================

The Nuggets have multiple starters listed.

####  | Dec 14, 2023

!

Injury Report: Denver Nuggets vs Brooklyn Nets /

In this story:

*   
*   



* * *

Fresh off of a controversial Nikola Jokic ejection, the Denver Nuggets now face off against the Brooklyn Nets tonight. They have multiple starters listed on the injury report, though.

The Denver Nuggets have seven players listed on their injury report: Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Vlatko Cancar, Collin Gillespie, Aaron Gordon, Jay Huff, Braxton Key, and Jamal Murray.

Kentavious Caldwell-Pope is out due to being in concussion protocol, Vlatko Cancar is out due to left knee surgery, Collin Gillespie is out due to a G League two-way, Aaron Gordon is probable due to a right heel strain, Jay Huff is out due to a G League two-way, Braxton Key is out due to a G League two-way, and Jamal Murray is probable due to bilateral ankle sprains.

The Brooklyn Nets have seven players listed on their injury report: Noah Clowney, Dorian Finney-Smith, Keon Johnson, Ben Simmons, Dennis Smith Jr., Lonnie Walker IV, and Dariq Whitehead. Noah Clowney is out on a G League assignment, Dorian Finney-Smith is questionable due to left knee soreness, Keon Johnson is out due to a G League two-way, Ben Simmons is out due to left lower back nerve impingement, Dennis Smith Jr. is out due to an upper back sprain, Lonnie Walker IV is out due to a left hamstring strain, and Dariq Whitehead is out on a G League assignment.

With the way things look, this is a game the Nuggets should have a massive advantage in. The two teams face off at 9:00 p.m. EST tonight.

web_search_results.title: Brooklyn Nets vs. Denver Nuggets Head-to-Head in the NBA Regular Season
key_points: The Brooklyn Nets and Denver Nuggets have played a total of 100 regular season games against each other.
The Nuggets lead the all-time series with 55 wins compared to the Nets' 45 victories.
In the 2023-24 season, the Nets lost to the Nuggets on December 22, 2023, with a score of 117-122.
The Nets also lost to the Nuggets on December 14, 2023, with a score of 101-124.
The historical performance includes detailed game logs, scores, and win-loss records spanning multiple seasons.

web_search_results.title: Denver Nuggets Historical Statistics and All-Time Top Leaders
key_points: The Denver Nuggets have a historical record of 2367 wins and 2248 losses, resulting in a .513 winning percentage.
The team has participated in 39 playoff appearances, with one championship title in the NBA.
The Nuggets have played a total of 58 seasons, including 49 in the NBA and 9 in the ABA.
As of the 2024-25 season, the Nuggets are currently 0-2 in their latest games.
The team is located in Denver, Colorado, and was originally known as the Denver Rockets.

web_search_results.title: NBA Weather Forecast - NBAstuffer
key_points: The article visualizes NBA teams' performance based on efficiency differentials across divisions.
Performance metrics include the last 5 games (L 5) and season averages (Avg) for each team.
Teams are categorized by divisions: Atlantic, Central, Southeast, Northwest, Pacific, and Southwest.
Images represent weather conditions affecting teams' performance, such as sunny, cloudy, rain, and snow.
For example, the LA Lakers have a strong performance with L 5: +16.2 and Avg: +11.6, indicating a hot streak.
web_search_results.raw_text:
[2] Published: June 06 2017 17:20 Title: NBA Weather Forecast - NBAstuffer Content: Since the is one the best of predictors of future success, I thought it might be fun to visualize NBA teams (division-by-division) in terms of efficiency differential. L 5: stands for Last 5 games, and “Avg” stands for Season Average

web_search_results.title: Bay Area Weather Forecast
key_points: Current temperature is 65°F with a humidity of 57% and a wind speed of 14 MPH.
Chance of precipitation is low throughout the day, ranging from 0% to a maximum of 7%.
High temperature today is expected to reach 66°F, with a low of 48°F.
The forecast for the next few days includes mostly sunny conditions with temperatures peaking at 74°F.
Saturday is expected to have showers with a 41% chance of precipitation and a high of 64°F.
Meteorologist Kari Hall provides insights on upcoming winter-like temperatures.

web_search_results.title: NBA Injury Status - 2024-25 Season - ESPN
key_points: Brooklyn Nets players ruled out for the game against the Denver Nuggets include: Watford (hamstring), Bogdanovic (foot), and Simmons (lower back injury management).
Watford is expected to return on October 29, while Bogdanovic and Simmons are also out for the same date.
Sharpe, a center for the Nets, is out until at least November 19 due to a left hamstring strain.
The injury report includes multiple teams, with various players listed as out or day-to-day across the league.

!Atlanta Hawks

| NAME | POS | EST. RETURN DATE | STATUS | COMMENT |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  | SF | Oct 30 | Out | Oct 28: Hunter (knee) has been ruled out ahead of Monday's game against Washington, Brad Rowland of the Locked On Podcast Network reports. |
|  | C | Oct 30 | Out | Oct 28: Correcting a previous report, Zeller (personal) will be unavailable for Monday's game against the Wizards. |
|  | SG | Oct 30 | Out | Oct 28: Bogdanovic (hamstring) will not play in Monday's game against the Wizards, Brad Rowland of the Locked On Podcast Network reports. |
|  | PF | Oct 30 | Out | Oct 28: Okongwu (rest) will not play Monday against the Wizards, Brad Rowland of the Locked On Podcast Network reports. |
|  | G | Oct 30 | Out | Oct 26: Lundy (ankle) is out for Sunday's game against the Thunder. |
|  | F | Oct 30 | Out | Oct 26: Barlow (back) is out for Sunday's game against the Thunder. |
|  | G | Nov 4 | Out | Oct 24: Bufkin (shoulder) won't play during Friday's game versus the Hornets. |

!Boston Celtics

| NAME | POS | EST. RETURN DATE | STATUS | COMMENT |

|  | C | Dec 1 | Out | Sep 24: Brad Stevens said that Porzingis (foot) is making good progress since his foot surgery back in June, Jared Weiss of The Athletic reports. |

|  | SF | Oct 30 | Out | Oct 28: Bogdanovic (foot) won't play in Tuesday's game against Denver, Erik Slater of ClutchPoints.com reports. |
|  | PG | Oct 30 | Out | Oct 28: Simmons has been ruled out for Tuesday's game against the Nuggets due to lower back injury management, Brian Lewis of the New York Post reports. |
|  | C | Nov 19 | Out | Oct 7: Sharpe will miss at least six weeks with a left hamstring strain, Brett Siegel of ClutchPoints.com reports. |

key_points: Brooklyn Nets have multiple players listed as Game Time Decisions due to injuries, including a PF with a hamstring issue and an SF with a foot injury.
The Denver Nuggets have a player (PF) out for the season due to an Achilles injury.
Injuries across the NBA include players from various teams, with statuses ranging from 'Expected to be out until' specific dates to 'Game Time Decision'.
Notable injuries include a C from the Nets expected to be out until at least Nov 19, and a SG from the Mavericks expected to be out until at least Jan 20.
The report includes injury updates for multiple teams, indicating the impact of injuries on player availability for upcoming games.

web_search_results.title: Denver Nuggets vs Brooklyn Nets Injury Report Revealed
key_points: The Denver Nuggets face the Brooklyn Nets on December 22, 2023, at 7:30 p.m. EST.
The Nuggets have seven players on their injury report, including Vlatko Cancar (out due to left knee surgery) and Aaron Gordon (probable with a right heel strain).
The Nets also have seven players listed, with Ben Simmons out due to left lower back nerve impingement and Dennis Smith Jr. probable with an upper back strain.
Despite the injuries, the Nuggets are expected to have their entire starting lineup available, giving them a health advantage in the matchup.
The article suggests that the Nuggets, having recently found their groove, should handle the game against the Nets well.

Published: December 22 2023 19:00
Title: Denver Nuggets vs Brooklyn Nets Injury Report Revealed - Sports Illustrated Denver Nuggets News, Analysis and More
Content: Denver Nuggets vs Brooklyn Nets Injury Report Revealed - Sports Illustrated Denver Nuggets News, Analysis and More
===============

](https://www.si.com/nba/nuggets/)

*

*   

Denver Nuggets vs Brooklyn Nets Injury Report Revealed
======================================================

The Nuggets should have the advantage.

####  | Dec 22, 2023

!

Denver Nuggets vs Brooklyn Nets Injury Report Revealed /

In this story:

*   
*   



* * *

The Denver Nuggets face off against the Brooklyn Nets tonight in a matchup that Denver should have the advantage in, especially from a health perspective.

The Nuggets have seven players listed on their injury report: Vlatko Cancar, Collin Gillespie, Aaron Gordon, Jay Huff, Braxton Key, Jalen Pickett, and Hunter Tyson. Vlatko Cancar is out due to left knee surgery, Collin Gillespie is out due to a G League two-way, Aaron Gordon is probable with a right heel strain, Jay Huff is out due to a G League two-way, Braxton Key is out due to a G League two-way, Jalen Pickett is out due to a G League assignment, and Hunter Tyson is out due to a G League assignment. The entire Nuggets' starting five lineup should be available tonight.

The Brooklyn Nets have seven players listed on their injury report: Armoni Brooks, Noah Clowney, Keon Johnson, Ben Simmons, Dennis Smith Jr., Lonnie Walker IV, and Dariq Whitehead. Armoni Brooks is out due to a G League two-way, Noah Clowney is out due to a G League assignment, Keon Johnson is out due to a G League two-way, Ben Simmons is out due to left lower back nerve impingement, Dennis Smith Jr. is probable with an upper back strain, Lonnie Walker IV is out due to a left hamstring strain, and Dariq Whitehead is out due to a G League assignment.

If the Denver Nuggets have their entire starting lineup available, this should be a game they handle. Denver has recently found its groove, and shouldn't slow down against the Nets.

The Denver Nuggets and Brooklyn Nets face off tonight at 7:30 p.m. EST.

summary: The Denver Nuggets (0-2) will face the Brooklyn Nets (1-2) at Barclays Center. The Nuggets are coming off two losses to start the 2024-25 season, while the Nets have a slightly better record with one win against the Bucks. Nikola Jokic has been leading the Nuggets with strong performances, while Cam Thomas has been the leading scorer for the Nets. Both teams are dealing with injury concerns, with several key players potentially missing the game.

key_people.name: Nikola Jokic
key_people.role: Denver Nuggets star player, crucial for team offense with 25 points, 12 rebounds, and 9 assists expected performance

key_people.name: Cam Thomas
key_people.role: Brooklyn Nets key scoring player, projected to contribute 24 points, but lacking support from starters due to injuries

key_people.name: Michael Malone
key_people.role: Denver Nuggets head coach, focusing on strategy to get first win of the season

key_people.name: Jordi Fernández
key_people.role: Brooklyn Nets head coach, implementing a defensive approach, and focusing on developing young players
